Package nzilbb.labbcat.server.servlet

Endpoints providing an HTTP-based API for access to transcripts, annotations, media, and functions that manipulate them.

All LaBB-CAT requests for which the the Accept HTTP header is set to application/json return a JSON response with the same standard envelope structure:

title
(string) The title of the LaBB-CAT instance.
version
(string) The version of the LaBB-CAT instance
code
(int) 0 if the request was successful, 1 if there was a problem
messages
An array of message strings.
errors
An array of error message strings.
model
The result of the request, which may be a JSON object, JSON array, or a simple type.

e.g. the response to http://localhost:8080/labbcat/api/store/getLayer?id=transcript might be: 

{
    "title":"LaBB-CAT",
    "version":"20200129.1901",
    "code":0,
    "errors":[],
    "messages":[],
    "model":{
        "id":"transcript",
        "parentId":"turns",
        "description":"Original transcription",
        "alignment":2,
        "peers":true,
        "peersOverlap":false,
        "parentIncludes":true,
        "saturated":false,
        "type":"string",
        "validLabels":{},
        "category":null
    }
}

If the Accept-Language request header is set, the server will endeavor to localize messages to the specified language.

Annotation Graph store functions include:

  • GraphStoreQuery functions for querying transcripts/annotations.
  • GraphStore functions for editing transcripts/annotations
  • GraphStoreAdministration functions for defining the data schema, annotation automation, etc.
  • and other LaBB-CAT-specific functions which listed below …
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AdminCorpora
    /api/admin/corpora : Administration of corpus records.
    AdminInfo
    /api/admin/info : Administration of the corpus information document.
    AdminMediaTracks
    /api/admin/mediatracks[/suffix] : Administration of media track records.
    AdminPassword
    /api/admin/password : sets user's password.
    AdminProjects
    /api/admin/projects[/project] : Administration of project records.
    AdminRolePermissions
    /api/admin/roles/permissions[/role_id[/entity]] : Administration role permissions records.
    AdminRoles
    /api/admin/roles[/role_id] : Administration of role records.
    AdminSystemAttributes
    /api/admin/systemattributes : Administration of system attribute records.
    AdminUsers
    /api/admin/users[/user] : Administration of user records.
    Attributes
    /api/attributes : Exports selected attributes for specified transcripts to CSV.
    Files
    /api/files : Exports media/transcript files for specified transcripts.
    Info
    /api/info : Corpus information document.
    LabbcatServlet
    Base class for other servlets.
    LayerManagers
    /api/layers/managers/ : Access to layer managers.
    MultipartRequestParameters
    Utility class for loading details from a multipart (file) upload request.
    Praat
    /api/praat : Processes a given set of audio intervals with Praat.
    SerializeFragments
    /api/serialize/fragment : Converts transcript fragments to specific formats.
    SerializeGraphs
    /api/serialize/graphs : Converts transcripts to specific formats.
    Store
    /api/edit/store/… : GraphStore functions.
    StoreAdministration
    /api/admin/store/… : GraphStoreAdministration functions.
    StoreQuery
    /api/store/… : GraphStoreQuery functions.
    SystemAttributes
    /api/systemattributes/name : Access to system attributes.
    TableServletBase
    Base class that handles generic database table management.
    User
    /api/user : information about the current user.
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    RequiredRole
    Annotation for a LabbcatServlet subclass which defines the user role required to make requests to the servlet.
